meanings.definition: to grant land to a tenant in exchange for services or rent.
meanings.sent1: The landlord was subinfeudating the property to the new tenant.
meanings.sent2: She subinfeudated the land to the farmer for agricultural work.
meanings.sent3: The king subinfeudated the castle to the jester for entertaining the court.
meanings.sent4: By subinfeudating the estate, he ensured a steady income from the rent.
meanings.sent5: Subinfeudating the house to the family brought in much-needed revenue.

meanings.definition: the act of creating a subinfeudation.
meanings.sent1: The subinfeudating of the estate was a complex legal process.
meanings.sent2: Her subinfeudating of the land led to disputes among the heirs.
meanings.sent3: The subinfeudating of the property caused confusion among the villagers.
meanings.sent4: His subinfeudating of the farm resulted in a clear division of ownership.
meanings.sent5: The subinfeudating of the manor was carefully documented by the scribe.

meanings.definition: the process of subdividing land into smaller parcels.
meanings.sent1: The subinfeudating of the fields allowed for more efficient farming.
meanings.sent2: She oversaw the subinfeudating of the estate into individual plots.
meanings.sent3: The subinfeudating of the land created a vibrant community.
meanings.sent4: His subinfeudating of the property increased its overall value.
meanings.sent5: The subinfeudating of the land brought new opportunities for development.
